data.title: Shildon AFC
data.meta_description: "Inspiring people to be the best they can be."
data.text:
Shildon are through to the next round of the FA Cup with a 2-0 victory at home to Morpeth Town.

Matty Robson gave Shildon the lead 10mins into the first half from the penalty spot after Jamie Harwood was brought down in the box.

In the second half, Lewis Dodds doubled the lead after charging down a clearance from the Morpeth Keeper. At the other end, Nick Liversedge produce a couple of fine saves to preserve his clean sheet.

Final Score: Shildon 2 Morpeth Town 0

Man Of The Match: Matty Robson

We are delighted that we have completed the signing of attacking midfield/forward David Renyard to go straight into the squad for the FA Cup game against Morpeth Town on Saturday.

The 28-year-old brings a wealth of experience to the club having played at Gretna, Celtic Nation, and Workington.

Welcome to the Club Dave.

The Supporters Club are running a coach to our first League game of the season away to Dunston UTS on Tuesday evening (8th August) leaving the Football Ground at 18:15.

If you would like to reserve a seat please either text Paul on 07704 828 522 or see him at the Morpeth game on Saturday.

The Draws for the FA Vase & FA Cup have been made, Shildon’s opponents will be: –

FA Cup

Morpeth Town (H) on 5th August

Winners will be away to either Stockton or Guisborough in the next round

FA Vase

We will start in the 2nd Round proper which is due to take place on the 11th November after being given a bye for the first 3 rounds.

Shildon AFC awarded £57,027 to build new stand

The Premier League through the Football Stadia Improvement Fund ( FSIF), the largest funder of non-league football in this country, recently announced a grant of £57,027 to Shildon AFC

The grant will enable the Club to build a new 200 seated stand, providing much needed accommodation to enhance spectator experience.

The project will see the building of a purpose built stand to replace the upper seated section of the existing stand. The project which is being undertaken by Vest Construction and Stadium Solutions is due to commence on September 17 with completion due before Christmas.

Funded with £5.2m each year from the Premier League, the FSIF is the country’s largest provider of grants towards projects that help improve the comfort and safety of lower league football grounds in both the professional and amateur game. These improvements range from new football stands and turnstiles to floodlighting and improved provision for disabled supporters.

David Dent, Chairman of Shildon AFC said ” thanks to the support of the Premier League through the FSIF, we can now offer our supporters and the wider community a much improved experience when they come to the game. Shildon AFC prides itself on being a true community focused football club and the improved facilities will not only benefit supporters watching our first team but also all of those who attend Academy games and our Development Centre days. This is an important milestone for the Club and hopefully will be the catalyst for further improvements to the ground as we seek to go as far as we can up the pyramid ”
